Remorse for what? You people have done everything in the world to me. Doesn't that give me equal right? I can do anything I want to you people at anytime I want to because that's what you've done to me. If you spit in my face and smack me in the mouth and throw me in solitary confinement for nothing, what do you think's gonna happen when I get outta here? Maybe I haven't done enough, I might be ashamed of that, for not doing enough. For not giving enough. For not being more perceptive. For not being aware enough. For not understanding. For, um, being stupid. Maybe I should have killed four or five hundred people, then I would have felt better. Then I would have felt like I really offered society something. You've got it stuck in your brain that I murdered somebody. What do you want to call me a murderer for? I've never killed anyone. I don't need to kill anyone. I think it. I have it here. Believe me, if I started murdering people, there'd be none of you left. Believe me, if I started murdering people, there'd be none of you left.

The word """"Hindu"""" is an invented and foreign word, that is indeed only a few hundreds years old. You can study all the Vedas and never find the word Hindu mentioned even once. Therefore, when I made my statement above, it is not out of ignorance, and instead based on years of study of the Vedic scriptures themselves, Sanskrit, as well as a fascination with ancient history. However, if you say that yoga has its basis in the Vedas, that would be a true statement. @Vaibav Singh: Hindu is a foreign name, as well as regional name, given by Islamic invaders to the people living east of the Sindhu River. The statues of gods you are referring to are not actually Hindu, and existed long before Islam or any other foreign invader of India. Please do some research before making your comment. @Sandeep Ks: Prove which Veda the word Hindu comes from?
